sentences.en: " Now, then, " he said, leading the way up the foyer into the theatre.
sentences.cn: “ 现在跟我来吧. " 他说着带头穿过休息处进了正厅.

sentences.en: A gaggle of journalists sit in a hotel foyer waiting impatiently.
sentences.cn: 一群乱哄哄的记者坐在酒店大堂里焦急地等待着。

sentences.en: A giant photograph of the actor hangs in the foyer of the theatre.
sentences.cn: 那位演员的巨幅照片挂在剧场的休息室里.

sentences.en: A nice tree twinkles its ornaments in the foyer.
sentences.cn: 一棵漂亮的树装饰得闪闪发光.

sentences.en: Anne left Artie and walked down the corridor towards the foyer.
sentences.cn: 安妮离开阿蒂，沿着走廊朝休息室走去。

sentences.en: Full - length court portraits of the king and queen dominated the foyer.
sentences.cn: 国王和王后的全身宫装画像高挂在门厅.

sentences.en: He got up and went out into the foyer.
sentences.cn: 他起身出去走进了大堂。

sentences.en: I went and waited in the foyer.
I'll meet you in the foyer at 7 o'clock.
sentences.cn: 我七点钟和你在门厅见面.

sentences.en: I'll meet you in the foyer.
The chandelier - decked foyer of the venue itself was freezing.
sentences.cn: 有着大吊灯的门厅室内温度都很低.

sentences.en: Unperturbed, she continued surveying the hotel foyer.
sentences.cn: 她不动声色地继续观察着那饭店的门厅.

sentences.en: Wait until I am back in the foyer before you make the switch, all right ?
sentences.cn: 你换之前在大厅等我回来, 没问题 吧 ?

sentences.en: We'll meet in the foyer at 9 p.m.
sentences.cn: 我们晚上九点在大堂见面.

trans.tran_cn: 休息室，（戏院或旅馆的）门厅，前厅
trans.tran_en: a room or hall at the entrance to a public building
